paper_abstract: The Satisfiability Modulo Theories Competition (SMT-COMP) is an annual competition aimed to stimulating the advance of the state-of-the-art techniques and tools developed by the Satisfiability Modulo Theories (SMT) community. As with the first two editions, SMT-COMP 2007 was held as a satellite event of CAV 2007, held July 3-7, 2007. This paper gives an overview of the rules, competition format, benchmarks, participants and results of SMT-COMP 2007.
paper_title: DESIGN AND RESULTS OF THE 3RD ANNUAL SATISFIABILITY MODULO THEORIES COMPETITION (SMT-COMP 2007)
